result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 8/9/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $15,000 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DSW, DSW, or VRW. 
- Defendant shall not be on Wayridge Dr in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any minor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DSW or his immediate family. 
- Defendant to remain at residence of 6777 Schroeder Rd Apt 2 or residential property. 
- Defendant is allowed to leave the residence for legal appointments with preapproval from Pretrial Services.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
